thread.title: Facebook To Pay £17m A Year For New London HQ
thread.title_full: Facebook To Pay £17m A Year For New London HQ

title: Facebook To Pay £17m A Year For New London HQ
text:
Tip : Use comma (,) to separate multiple quotes. Learn more... 
Fri, Sep 11, 2015, 15:23 BST - UK Markets close in 1 hr 7 mins Facebook To Pay £17m A Year For New London HQ By (c) Sky News 2015 | Sky News – 10 minutes ago View Photo 

Facebook (NasdaqGS: FB - news ) looks set to increase its London presence after it signed a deal to move into a unfinished office development near Tottenham Court Road. 
Great Portland Estates (Other OTC: GPEAF - news ) announced it had pre-let all of the office space in its development at Rathbone Square to the social media giant. 
Robert Cookson, Facebook's real estate boss, said “The move to our new offices at One Rathbone Square highlights our commitment to invest and grow our talented teams of people based in London. 
"This is a fantastic opportunity to occupy a high quality new development in the heart of the West End. The location has excellent amenities and connectivity, with the very best the city has to offer right on the doorstep including Crossrail once it is established.” 
Facebook will pay nearly £17m a year in rent to occupy the more than 227,000 sq. ft of office space - but as part of the deal will pay no rent for the first 30 months of the tenancy. 
The length of the tenancy is set at 15 years, and will commence once the site is completed, which is scheduled for February 2017. 
According to industry averages, an office of this size has the potential to house around 2,000 staff, depending on worker density. 
Facebook housed just over 200 employees at its Brock Street offices last year. 
Great Portland Estates acquired the Rathbone Square site from Royal Mail Group in September 2011.
